alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:45AM PST until December 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE NEXT WEEK... .The first in several rounds of precipitation will spread across Northwest California today. Snow levels will range from 2500 to 3000 feet across Trinity County this afternoon, and then rise through the evening. Accumulating snowfall will occur as a result leading to travel impacts mainly along highway 3 north of Weaverville. Precipitation will diminish Tuesday night, and then increase once again Wednesday afternoon and evening. Snow levels on Wednesday will generally be above 4000 feet. However, colder air will spread across the region Friday into the weekend and aid in lowering snow levels to 2000 feet across much of Northwest California. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3000 feet, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
